flawed_nl_solution:
1 roll can wrap 5 shirt boxes and he has 20 shirts boxes to wrap so he needs 20/5 = <<20/5=4>>4 rolls of wrap
1 roll can wrap 3 XL boxes and he has 12 XL boxes to wrap so he needs 12/3 = <<12/3=4>>4 rolls or wrap
All total he needs 4+4 = <<4+4=13>>13 rolls of wrap
Each roll costs $4 and he needs 13 rolls so it will cost him 4*13 = $<<4*13=52>>52 in wrapping paper
#### 52

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 8, not 13. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
